title: P06-1013

sentences.text: Combination methods are an effective way of improving system performance .
This paper examines the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD .
We investigate several voting - and arbiter-based combination strategies over a diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems .
Our combination methods rely on predominant senses which are derived automatically from raw text .
Experiments using the SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets demonstrate that our ensembles yield significantly better results when compared with state-of-the-art .

Entity-our_combination_method.label: Our combination methods
Entity-our_combination_method.description: A set of approaches that combine multiple unsupervised WSD systems to improve their performance by relying on predominantly sensed meanings automatically extracted from raw text.

Entity-the_benefit_of_system_combination.label: the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD
aliases: the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD
Entity-the_benefit_of_system_combination.description: The advantages gained by combining multiple systems for performing Word Sense Disambiguation without supervision.

Entity-voting_-_and_arbiter-based_combin.label: voting - and arbiter-based combination strategies
Entity-voting_-_and_arbiter-based_combin.description: Several algorithmic methods that combine the outputs of multiple unsupervised Word Sense Disambiguation (WSD) systems using voting and arbiter-based strategies.

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper
Entity-this_paper.description: The current research study examining the benefits and strategies of combining systems for unsupervised Word Sense Disambiguation (WSD).

Entity-unsupervised_wsd_system.label: unsupervised WSD systems
Entity-unsupervised_wsd_system.description: A type of software system that performs Word Sense Disambiguation (WSD) without human supervision, used for natural language processing and information retrieval.

aliases: a diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems
Entity-a_diverse_pool_of_unsupervised_ws.description: A collection of various machine learning models that perform word sense disambiguation without human supervision, used for combining and improving their performance.

Entity-unsupervised_wsd.label: unsupervised WSD
Entity-unsupervised_wsd.description: The process of assigning word senses to words in text without using labeled training data

Entity-wsd_system.label: WSD systems
Entity-wsd_system.description: Systems that perform Word Sense Disambiguation, which involves identifying the correct sense or meaning of words with multiple meanings.

Entity-our_ensemble.description: A collection of machine learning models or algorithms used together to improve performance.

Entity-combination_method.description: A method or approach that combines multiple techniques, strategies, or principles to achieve a specific goal or outcome.

summary: Combination methods are an effective way of improving system performance . This paper examines the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD . We investigate several voting - and arbiter-based combination strategies over a diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems . Our combination methods rely on predominant senses which are derived automatically from raw text . Experiments using the SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets demonstrate that our ensembles yield significantly better results when compared with state-of-the-art .

Predicate-are_an_effective_way_of_improv.label: are an effective way of improving
Predicate-are_an_effective_way_of_improv.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has a direct and significant impact on achieving or enhancing the object. It suggests a causal relationship between the subject's existence or application and the improvement of the object, implying a positive outcome.

Predicate-examines.label: examines
Predicate-examines.description: To examine a predicate means to investigate or analyze its properties, characteristics, or implications. In this sense, the subject (e.g., This paper) engages in an intellectual inquiry into the object (e.g., the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD), seeking to understand and interpret it.

Predicate-investigate.label: investigate
Predicate-investigate.description: To investigate means to systematically examine or analyze something (the object) with the intention of gaining insight, understanding, or uncovering information about it. The subject performs this examination or analysis to gather knowledge, identify patterns, or solve a problem related to the object.

Predicate-derive_automatically_from.label: derive automatically from
Predicate-derive_automatically_from.description: This predicate indicates that the subject generates or obtains its characteristics, properties, or rules directly and immediately from the object. The connection between the subject and object implies a causal relationship where the object serves as the source of inspiration, guidance, or foundation for the subject's development.

Predicate-demonstrate_that.label: demonstrate that
Predicate-demonstrate_that.description: To predicate 'demonstrate that' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g., Experiments) provides evidence or proof to support or validate the object (e.g., our ensembles), typically implying a sense of verification, confirmation, or validation.

Predicate-yield_significantly_better_res.label: yield significantly better results when compared with
Predicate-yield_significantly_better_res.description: This predicate indicates a comparative advantage or superiority of the subject over the object. It suggests that the subject possesses qualities or characteristics that lead to more desirable outcomes, making it a better choice than the object when compared.

Predicate-examine.label: examine
Predicate-examine.description: To examine means to investigate or scrutinize something in order to gain a deeper understanding or insight. It implies a systematic and thorough analysis, often with the goal of identifying patterns, relationships, or underlying principles.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subclass of a more general category or class represented by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject is a narrower or more specialized version of the object.
